content.description: This short route packs a little more punch than you might expect at first glance.  Jam and take advantage of the patina plates as this right-angling crack continuously widens towards the top.
content.protection: Single rack of cams from fingers to wide hands.  Two bolt anchor with chains.
content.location:
It is located on the upper west face of Meadow rock.  Scramble up the initial corner of "

The Dark

," and belay amongst the giant bowls on the ledge.

content.description: Kudos to the first ascentionist for finding this gem!  The Dark climbs the obvious crack that jogs up and left through the STEEP headwall.  Start in the left-facing corner, and make a reachy traverse left on brilliantly sculpted granite to enter the crack proper.  Catch your breath since this is probably the last time you will have your feet directly below you for the rest of the climb. Employ all your crack and face climbing skills as you fight off a growing pump in a race to the anchors.
content.protection: Large nuts and a single rack of cams from fingers to hands.  2 bolt anchor with chains.
content.location: This is the obvious crack that splits the overhanging north face of Meadow Rock.  Start in the left-facing corner that lies 8 feet to the right of the crack (the direct start may be doable but is very thin and unprotected).
